SEARCH
Package Game.Entitys

Class Enemy

java.lang.Object
Game.Entitys.Enemy
All Implemented Interfaces:
Entity
public class Enemy extends Object implements Entity
The Enemy class represents an enemy entity in the game, with properties such as name, power, health and division. It implements the Entity interface and provide methods for managing the enemy's state.
Author:
Tânia Morais, Tomás Neto

    • takeDamage

      public void takeDamage(int damage)
      Reduces the enemy's health by a specified damage amount. If the health drops below zero, it is set to zero
      Specified by:
      takeDamage in interface Entity
      Parameters:
      damage - the amount of damage to be inflicted on the enemy

    • calculateHealth

      public int calculateHealth(int OpositePower) throws InvalidElementException
      Calculates the remaining health of the enemy after taking damage based on the opposite power.
      Specified by:
      calculateHealth in interface Entity
      Parameters:
      OpositePower - the power of the opposing entity, which is used to calculate the damage.
      Returns:
      the remaining health of the enemy after taking the damage
      Throws:
      InvalidElementException - if the opposite power is less than or equal to zero

    • isAlive

      public boolean isAlive()
      Checks whether the enemy is still alive.
      Specified by:
      isAlive in interface Entity
      Returns:
      true if the enemy's health is greater than zero, false otherwise.
